thread.title: CU-Boulder gets 50 more tickets for the GOP debate
thread.title_full: CU-Boulder gets 50 more tickets for the GOP debate - The Denver Post

author: Sarah Kuta, Staff Writer
title: CU-Boulder gets 50 more tickets for the GOP debate
text:
The Republican National Committee is giving 50 extra tickets to University of Colorado faculty and students, bringing the total number of CU tickets to 150 for the Republican presidential debate being held on campus on Wednesday.
The total audience size for the nationally televised debate remains at just over 1,000 people, according to a news release.
"We are grateful to the RNC for responding to our request to allow more students and faculty to witness this historic event on our campus," said Chancellor Phil DiStefano in a statement. "In addition to those attending the debate, we have many related opportunities for our students, whether that's attending a watch party, participating in a faculty-led discussion of the issues, volunteering with CNBC's production or attending classroom presentations led by prominent journalists."
CU students have complained about the limited availability of tickets and are hosting their own watch party and live debate broadcast and discussion on campus.
Tickets are being distributed to faculty and students whose area of study have a direct tie to debate-related topics, such as presidential politics, the election process, media, and the economy.
Some tickets are being provided to faculty members, who can each invite four students to attend with them. Other tickets are being distributed to the CU Student Government.
